title: TOI
content:
Ahead of releasing 20 Israeli hostages, Hamas orchestrated emotional video calls between captives and their families in Gaza. Footage showed masked Hamas operatives beside the hostages, many wearing fake military uniforms. Families at Israel’s Re’im base reacted with tears and relief as hostages confirmed they were safe. This marked a shift from prior propaganda ceremonies. The releases are part of a Trump-brokered ceasefire, with Hamas set to hand over hostages to the Red Cross, while Israel prepares to release over 1,900 Palestinian prisoners.

The U.S. has unveiled a powerful new mobile missile launcher, the Extreme Multi-Mission Autonomous Vehicle (X-MAV), capable of firing Tomahawk cruise missiles with pinpoint precision. President Donald Trump declared he’s ready to send Tomahawks to Ukraine, escalating tensions with Moscow. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said such long-range missiles could force Russia into negotiations. Experts warn the weapon’s 2,500-kilometer range puts Moscow and St. Petersburg within reach. As Trump prepares to meet Zelensky in Washington, the Kremlin faces a direct new threat from America’s advancing arsenal. Watch
